All Classes

Class Description
AbstractActionChoice
This class represents the generic ui state that is reached when the player in turn chooses the action he wants to perform during his turn.
AbstractActivateProduction
This abstract class deals with main action of the game consisting in activate productions and provides some methods to make consistency checks.
AbstractBuyDevCard
This class represents the generic ui state that is reached when the client chooses to buy a Development Card during his turn.
AbstractClientState
This is the highest-level class of the Client States hierarchy.
AbstractGameModeChoice
This class represents the generic game mode choice state which is reached by the client after the username choice.
AbstractInitialLeaderChoice
This class represents the generic ui state that is reached when the client has to choose which leader cards to discard during the initial choices phase of the game.
AbstractInitialResourceChoice
This class represents the generic ui state that is reached when the client has to choose the initial resources.
AbstractLeaderAction
This class represents the generic ui state that is reached when the client wants to activate or to discard a leader card during his turn.
AbstractLobby
This class represents the generic lobby state which is reached by the client after having chosen the number of players in Multiplayer Mode.
AbstractMoveResources
This class represents the generic ui state that is reached when the client wants to move resources in his depots.
AbstractNumOfPlayersChoice
This class represents the generic number of players choice state which is reached by the client after the game mode choice.
AbstractPositioningResources
This class represents the generic ui state reached when the client fails to position some resources and the server sends a ServerAsksForPositioning.
AbstractTakeResourcesFromMarket
This class represents the generic ui state that is reached when the client chooses to take resources from the MarketTray during his turn.
AbstractTurnPhase
This interface provides an abstraction of the main actions that can be performed during the game
AbstractUserNameChoice
This class represents the generic username choice state which is reached by the client at the launch of the game.
AbstractWaitForTurn
This class represents the generic wait for turn state that is reached by all the clients who aren't in turn.
ActionChoiceCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific state that is reached when the player in turn has to choose the action he wants to perform during his turn.
ActionError
Class that contains details related to an error encountered before even starting a normal action.
ActionError.Trigger
Enum representing for each possible error, a statement that describes it.
ActivateProduction
This class represents activate production action with all the method necessary to perform it.
ActivateProductionCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific state that is reached when the player in turn wants to activate productions during his turn.
ActivateProductionController
Class that represents the controller of the Activate Production page of the game on this page the user can choose which and how many productions to activate by selecting the productions on the top cards of the slots and possibly the basic production
ActivateProductionError
Class that contains information about errors that could be triggered while performing an ActivateProduction action.
ActivateProductionError.Trigger
Enum representing for each possible error, a statement that describes it.
ActivateProductionGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific state that is reached when the player in turn wants to activate productions during his turn.
ActivateProductionMessage
This class contains information regarding an ActivateProduction action.
ActivateProductionMessageTest
Test class whose task is to check all possible outcomes for ActivateProductionMessage validity.
ActivateProductionTest
Test class that tests the correct functioning of the ActivateProduction class and its functionalities
ActivateProductionUpdate
Class containing specific information about an activate production action successfully ended.
ActivateProductionUpdateController
Class that represents the controller of the ActivateVaticanReportPopup page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can see the update popup following a successful Activate Production action
ActivateVaticanReportEvent
When a player activates a vatican report, this event is notified to the Game class.
ActivateVaticanReportEventTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the activate Vatican Report
ActivateVaticanReportPopupController
Class that represents the controller of the ActivateVaticanReportPopup page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can see the update popup following a successful Activate Vatican Report action
ActivateVaticanReportUpdate
Class consisting an update concerning ActivateVaticanReportEvent.
ActiveProductions
This class represents all the productions that can be requested by a player in a turn.
ANSI_Color
Enum that allows colors usage in command line interface.
BackToMenuException
This exception is used in command line interface to find out if the player wants or needs to come back to action choice.
BlackCrossHitLastSpace
When Lorenzo il Magnifico reaches last space on the Faith Track, this event is notified.
BlackCrossHitLastSpaceTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the Black Cross Hit Last Space
BlackCrossMoveUpdate
Class instantiated when during a turn, LorenzoIlMagnifico moves his cross forward on player faith track according to tokens or as result of an action made by player itself.
BuyDevCard  
BuyDevCardCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific state that is reached when the player in turn wants to buy a DevelopmentCard during his turn.
BuyDevCardController
Class that represents the controller of the Buy Development Card page of the game on this page the user can perform the Buy Development Card action choosing the card you want to buy from one of the possible decks if you have the resources to buy it
BuyDevCardError
Class containing details about errors that can occur while performing a BuyDevCard action.
BuyDevCardError.Trigger
Enum representing a specific statement for each possible error.
BuyDevCardGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific state that is reached when the player in turn wants to buy a DevelopmentCard during his turn.
BuyDevCardMessage
This class contains information regarding a BuyDevCard action.
BuyDevCardMessageTest
Test class whose task is to check all possible outcomes for BuyDevCardMessage validity.
BuyDevCardPerformedUpdate
Class containing specific information about a development card purchase successfully performed.
BuyDevCardPopupController
Class that represents the controller of the BuyDevelopmentCardPopup page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can see the update popup following a successful TBuy Development Card action
BuyDevCardTest
Class that test a buy development card action.
CardType
This class represents a type of development card, which is a couple composed of a level and a color.
Checker
This class provides methods to manage map widely used client side.
ChooseActionController
Class that represents the controller of the ChooseAction page of the game On this page the user can choose which action to perform if he has not yet performed an action during his turn
CLI
Class that deals with user interaction through command line.
Client
Since the project supports the possibility of playing an offline solo mode match, this abstract class has methods and attributes that a NetworkClient and OfflineClient has in common to run and display game.
ClientMessage
Interface that provides an abstraction of messages that remote host can expect from client.
ClientStatus
This is a Runnable class that is instantiated whenever a client connects to the server and it holds the communication until a disconnection occurs.
CliStatesController
This class provides overloading methods to update status of the CLI after receiving a certain message, in the sense that this changes what a player graphically see in his command line interface and the interaction allowed at runtime.
Coin  
ColorCard
This enum contains all the possible colors of a development card.
ColorMarble
This enum contains all the possible colors of the Marbles of the MarketTray.
ConclusionEvent
This abstract class is extended by all the possible Conclusion Events which can occur during the game.
ConfigurationMessage
Interface that encapsulates all messages that allows client to configure a game before its beginning.
ConnectionStates
Enum that represents different states of a connection.
Controller
Main controller of all GUI scenes It is used to set the background and scene borders of each page Contains all generic methods that are used in all Controller classes of GUI pages
Deck
This class represents a deck of development cards.
Depot
This interface represents a generic depot of Maestri del Rinascimento board game.
DepotNotFoundException
Exception thrown when someone fails while searching for a depot associated to a particular resource type.
DepotOutOfBoundsException
Exception thrown when number of occurrences in a depot is greater than its size or less than zero.
DevCardColorEnded
When one color of Development Cards is no longer available, this event is notified.
DevCardColorEndedTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the Development Card Color Ended
DevelopmentCard
Represents a Development Card of Maestri del Rinascimento board game.
DiscardTwoBlueCards  
DiscardTwoBlueCardsTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the Discard Two Blue Cards in SoloMode
DiscardTwoGreenCards  
DiscardTwoGreenCardsTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the Discard Two Green Cards in SoloMode
DiscardTwoPurpleCards  
DiscardTwoPurpleCardsTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the Discard Two Purple Cards in SoloMode
DiscardTwoYellowCards  
DiscardTwoYellowCardsTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the Discard Two Yellow Cards in SoloMode
Effect
This enum contains all the possible effects of a LeaderCard of Maestri del Rinascimento board game.
EndTurnMessage
Class that represent a message sent to report a turn conclusion.
ErrorMessage
This abstract class represents a message concerned to an error found during game play.
ErrorPopupController
Class that represents the controller of the generic ErrorPopup page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can see the error message following an unsuccessful action
ExitController
Class that represents the controller of the Exit page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can log out of the game via the popup that is shown after pressing the exit button
ExtraDepot
Class that represent a particular implementation of Depot interface.
ExtraDepotTest
Test class that tests the correct functioning of the ExtraDepot class and its functionalities
FaithMarkerUpdate
Class representing an update after a TakeResourcesFromMarket action to notify a possible progress in faith track.
FaithTrack
This class represents the Faith Track of Maestri del Rinascimento board game.
FaithTrackTest
Test class that tests the correct functioning of the Faith Track class and its functionalities
Game
This is the main class of the Model of the MVC Architectural Pattern.
GameController
This class represents the Controller in MVC design pattern.
GameControllerHandleable
Interface that encapsulates all messages referred to the game.
GameControllerTest
Class that deals with GameController testing.
GameEvent
This interface is implements by al the possible events which can occur during the game.
GameMode
Enumeration to set game mode selected by client.
GameModeChoiceCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific game mode choice state which is reached by the client after the username choice.
GameModeChoiceGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific game mode choice state which is reached by the client after the username choice.
GameModeChoiceMessage
This class represent a specific ConfigurationMessage sent by client in order to choose between a multiplayer mode and solo mode game.
GameResumedMessage
Class that collects in a message all the information needed by a client that is reconnecting in order to let him resuming the game.
GameSetupMessage
Class representing first message sent to each player after a game creation.
GameState
Represents the current state of the game.
GenericPopupController
Class that represents the controller of the GenericPopup page of the game This page is used to represent a generic text popup that will contain a message following a certain action
Gui
Gui class representing Graphical User Interface part of the project that can be used as an alternative to CLI for this reason the both inherit from UI abstract class.
GUIApp
Main class to start GUI application.
HitLastSpace
When a player reaches the last space on his Faith Track, this event is notified.
HitLastSpaceTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the faith Hit Last Space
HomeController
Class that represents the controller of the Home page of the game this page is the game start page showing the game icon and a loading waiting for the game to start
IncompatibleResourceTypeException
This exception can thrown when the player is attempting to move resources in a way that breaks Warehouse rules.
InfoController
Class that represents the controller of the Info page of the game In this page the user not in turn is able to view the rules of the game
InitialLeaderChoiceCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific state that is reached when the client has to choose which leader cards to discard during the initial choices phase of the game.
InitialLeaderChoiceGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific state that is reached when the client has to choose which leader cards to discard during the initial choices phase of the game.
InitialLeaderChoiceUpdate
Class representing an update sent when a player correctly performs initial leaders choice by discarding two of his own cards.
InitialResourceChoiceCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific state that is reached when the client has to choose the initial resources.
InitialResourceChoiceGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific state that is reached when the client has to choose the initial resources.
InitialResourceChoiceUpdate
Class representing an update sent when player correctly performs initial resources choice.
InterruptedActionException
Exception thrown when a player is attempting to perform an action that he couldn't afford with resources currently in his Warehouse
InvalidActionException
Exception thrown when a player is trying to perform a normal action more then once in a turn.
InvalidMessageError
Class representing an error that occurred when a client sends a badly formatted message.
JoinLobbyMessage
Class representing a message sent from server when a player is added to a lobby in order to notifies other members inside it.
LastTurnMessage
Class representing a message sent from server when a player makes a move that starts ending phase of the game.
LeaderAction
This class implements one of the possible main action of the game turn.
LeaderActionCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific state that is reached when the client wants to activate or to discard a leader card during his turn.
LeaderActionController
Class that represents the controller of the LeaderAction page of the game on this page the user can perform a leader action by activating (if required) or discarding a leader card
LeaderActionError
Class containing information about errors found while performing a LeaderAction.
LeaderActionError.Trigger
Enum describing errors.
LeaderActionGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific state that is reached when the client wants to activate or to discard a leader card during his turn.
LeaderActionMessage
Class that contains information useful to perform a LeaderAction.
LeaderActionMessageTest
Test class whose task is to check all possible outcomes for LeaderActionMessage validity.
LeaderActionPopupController
Class that represents the controller of the LeaderActionPopup page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can see the update popup following a successful Leader action
LeaderActionTest
Class containing tests concerning a leader action.
LeaderActionUpdate
Class representing an update sent when a LeaderAction is successfully done.
LeaderCard
Class representing a physical leader card, that can be either activated or discarded by player during a turn.
LeaderChoiceController
Class that represents the controller of the LeaderChoice page of the game On this page the user must choose two out of four leader cards in order to start the game
LeaderChoiceMessage
Class containing information about how to perform initial leader choice.
LeaderEffect
This class represents a leader effect of a Leader Card of Maestri del Rinascimento board game.
LeaderRequirementsException
Exception thrown when player is trying to activate a LeaderCard but he doesn't satisfy its requirements because of missing development cards or resources.
LeaderStatusException
Exception thrown when a player is attempting to perform an action over a leader card that has been already activated.
LobbyCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific lobby state which is reached by the client after having chosen the number of players in Multiplayer Mode.
LobbyController
Class that represents the controller of the Lobby page of the game On this page the user will have to wait for the number of players chosen in the previous step to connect to the server to play the game
LorenzoActivatedAVaticanReport
When Lorenzo il Magnifico activates a vatican report, this event is notified to the Game class.
LorenzoActivatedAVaticanReportTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the Lorenzo activated a Vatican Report
LorenzoActivatedVaticanReportUpdate
Class representing an update sent in case of a solo mode game, when LorenzoIlMagnifico activates a Vatican Report.
LorenzoIlMagnifico
This class represents Lorenzo il Magnifico, who the player has to face in SoloMode.
LorenzoIlMagnificoTest
Test class that tests the actions performed by Lorenzo il Magnifico
LorenzoPlayedPopupController
Class that represents the controller of the LorenzoPlayedPopup page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can see the update popup following a successful action performed by Lorenzo il Magnifico
LorenzoPlayedUpdate
Class representing an update sent at the end of a turn while playing a solo mode game.
MaestriDelRinascimento  
Marble
Basic representation of a marble.
MarbleDestination
Enum used to bind a destination to each marble gained during a TakeResourcesFromMarket action.
MarketChoice
Enum used to select between rows and column in a TakeResourcesFromMarket action.
MarketTray
This class represents the market board containing thirteen marbles distributed over three rows and four columns and one remaining placed outside as stated by game rules.
MarketTrayTest
Test class that tests the methods of the MarketTray class
MoveActionController
Class that represents the controller of the Move Action page of the game on this page the user can perform the Move Resources action by choosing the type of move to be carried out and moving the resources of his choice
MoveActionInterface
This interface is part of the move action message and allows to the player to choose between different ways of moving resources in his warehouse.
MoveBlackCrossAndShuffle  
MoveBlackCrossAndShuffleTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the Move Black Cross And Shuffle in SoloMode
MoveBlackCrossByTwo  
MoveBlackCrossByTwoTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the Move Black Cross By Two in SoloMode
MoveFromExtraToNormalAction
A specific implementation of move action that involves an extra depot as starting point and a normal one as destination.
MoveFromExtraToNormalActionTest
Test class whose task is to check all possible outcomes for a move message requiring a move between a ExtraDepot and a NormalDepot.
MoveFromNormalToExtraAction
A specific implementation of MoveActionInterface that allows the player to move some resources from a NormalDepot to an ExtraDepot given their indexes.
MoveFromNormalToExtraActionTest
Test class whose task is to check all possible outcomes for a move message requiring a move between a NormalDepot and a ExtraDepot.
MoveFromNormalToNormalAction
Specific implementation of MoveActionInterface that allows the player to move resources from a NormalDepot to another NormalDepot.
MoveFromNormalToNormalActionTest
Test class whose task is to check all possible outcomes for a move message requiring a move between a NormalDepot and a NormalDepot.
MoveResourcesCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific state that is reached when the client wants to move resources in his depots.
MoveResourcesError
Class containing information about errors made by player who is attempting to settle pending resources coming from market tray in his depots.
MoveResourcesError.Trigger
Enum that describes error encountered.
MoveResourcesException
Exception thrown when a MoveActionInterface cannot be performed without violating game rules.
MoveResourcesGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific state that is reached when the client wants to move resources in his depots.
MoveResourcesMessage
Class containing information regarding a move action.
MoveUpdate
Class representing an update sent after a
MultiModeWinnerMessageController
Class that represents the controller of the MultiModeWinnerMessage page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can view the ranking of the match after it has finished and can view the winner of the match Finally he closes the game
MultiPlayerMode
This class extends the main class of the model Game, implementing one of the two possible modalities of Maestri del Rinascimento board game.
MultiPlayerModeTest
Class that collects all tests of multiplayer mode game.
NeedPositioningException
Exception that can be thrown when a player is in a TakeResourcesFromMarket phase and the model detects that it's impossible to settle a resource as specified by player.
NetworkClient
Since whole project is based on distributed MVC architectural pattern, this class has what is needed to exchange information with the server, especially it is the door through which the player sends messages and receives errors or updates.
NetworkRemoteView
Class that inherits from RemoteView and has also a reference to a ClientStatus that allows messages receiving and sending because server has to communicate with client.
NewTurnUpdate
Class representing an update sent in order to notify all player about who is the one in turn.
NormalDepot
This class represents the default type of depot of Maestri del Rinascimento board game.
NormalDepotTest
Test class that tests the correct functioning of the NormalDepot class and its functionalities
NoSuchResourceTypeException
This exception suggests that there is no resource type linked to a certain Marble.
NotAvailableNicknameMessage
Class representing a message sent from server in order to notify a guest that he has just chosen a not available nickname, so the selection has to be done again.
NotEnoughResourcesException
Exception thrown when model detects that player hasn't enough resources to perform an action that requires them.
NumOfPlayerChoiceGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific number of players choice state which is reached by the client after the game mode choice in MultiPlayerMode.
NumOfPlayerChoiceMessage
Class containing number of players selected to make up a multiplayer mode game.
NumOfPlayersChoiceCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific number of players choice state which is reached by the client after the game mode choice in MultiPlayerMode.
Observable<T>  
Observer<T>  
OfflineClient
This class represents the offline implementation of the main class client-side.
OfflineRemoteView
Class that inherits from RemoteView and implements the offline version of that class.
Pair<K,​V>
General class to create an object made by one attribute as a key and a second attribute as a value.
PaymentController
Interface that allows to handle player's decision while performing an action that requires picking resources from warehouse.
PaymentErrorException
Exception thrown when an error during the payment occurs.
PaymentHandler
This is a final class whose methods are used when a player has to pay something like a development card or a set of productions.
PersonalBoard  
PersonalBoardTest
Test class that tests the correct functioning of the PersonalBoard class and its functionalities
PingMessage
Class representing ping periodically sent through the network.
Player  
PlayerBoardController
Class that represents the controller of the PlayerBoard page of the game This page represents the user's main PlayerBoard, where he can make all the moves during his turn and see the boards of the other players when not in turn
PlayerTest
Class whose task is to test all player related methods.
PongMessage
Class representing a message sent from server executors in order to reply to a PingMessage sent before by client.
PositioningMessage
Class containing information about how to perform positioning of pending resources related a TakeResourcesFromMarket.
PositioningResourcesCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific state reached when the client fails to position some resources and the server sends a ServerAsksForPositioning.
PositioningResourcesController
Class that represents the controller of the PositioningResources page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can select where to place pending resources after incorrectly placing resources in the Take Resources From Market action
PositioningResourcesGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific state reached when the client fails to position some resources and the server sends a ServerAsksForPositioning.
PositioningUpdate
Class representing an update sent after a resources placement has been correctly performed.
ProductionRule
This class represents how a certain development card is able to convert resources.
ProductionRuleTest
Class to test a production rule and its changes.
RankMessage
Class representing final message received from server when a multiplayer mode game definitively ends.
RedMarble
This class inherit from abstract class Marble because it's present in the market board.
ReducedDepot
This class represents a simplified version of a depot with respect to the server's class.
ReducedFaithTrack
This class represents a simplified version of Faith Track with respect to the server's class.
ReducedGame
This class represents a simplified version of the Game with respect to the server's class.
ReducedMarble
This class represents a simplified version of a marble with respect to the server's class.
ReducedMarketTray
This class represents a simplified version of a Market Tray with respect to the server's class.
ReducedMultiPlayerMode
This class represents a simplified version of a MultiPlayerMode with respect to the server's class.

This class represents a simplified version of a PersonalBoard with respect to the server's class.

This class represents a simplified version of a Player with respect to the server's class.
ReducedSoloMode
This class represents a simplified version of a SoloMode with respect to the server's class.
ReducedStrongbox
This class represents a simplified version of a Strongbox with respect to the server's class.
ReducedTurn
This class represents a simplified version of the Turn with respect to the server's class.
ReducedWarehouse
This class represents a simplified version of a Warehouse with respect to the server's class.
RemoteView
This abstract class represents View component in MVC architectural pattern, it is bound to a specific user.
ResourceChoiceController
Class that represents the controller of the ResourceChoice page of the game On this page the user, except player 1, will have to choose one or two resources of his choice based on his position in the game
ResourceChoiceMessage
Class containing information in order to perform initial resources choice.
ResourceLocator
Final class created to find URLs, string used by CLI and Gui classes to display objects.
ResourceMismatchException
This exception can be thrown while processing a message that requires resources analysis.
ResourceSource
Enum representing sources from which a player can pick resources to perform an action of the game.
ResourceType
This enum represents the set of standard resources that can be stored in player's warehouse or extra depots.
SelectModeController
Class that represents the controller of the SelectMode page of the game On this page the user must choose the game mode between SoloMode and MultiplayerMode
SelectNumOfPlayersController
Class that represents the controller of the SelectNumbersOfPlayers page of the game On this page the user must choose the number of players he wants to play with Once the choice has been made, the user will be placed in a lobby waiting for the number of chosen players to connect
Servant  
Server
Class that handles all aspects related to network server-side.
ServerAskForGameMode
Class representing a message through server asks the guest which kind of mode he wants to play.
ServerAskForNumOfPlayer
Class representing a message sent from server in order to ask the guest the number of players he wants in a game.
ServerAsksForNickname
Class representing the first message exchanged by server and connecting client, in order to let him choose its nickname.
ServerAsksForPositioning
Class representing one of possible update resulting from a TakeResourcesFromMarket.
ServerMessage
Interface that encapsulates all messages sent by server to clients.
SeventhDevCardBought
When a player buys his seventh DevelopmentCard, this event is notified.
SeventhDevCardBoughtTest
Test class that tests the activation event of the Seventh Development Card Bought
Shield  
Slot
This class represents a slot of the PersonalBoard.
SoloMode
This class extends the main class of the model Game, implementing one of the two possible modalities of Maestri del Rinascimento board game.
SoloModeMatchWinnerMessage
Class consisting of a message sent at the end of a solo mode game.
SoloModeTest
Test class that tests the game in SoloMode with all its associated actions
SoloModeWinnerMessageController
Class that represents the controller of the SoloModeWinnerMessage page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can view the user can see if he has won or lost against Lorenzo il Magnifico and in case of victory he is shown the score Finally he closes the game
StandardMarble
This class represents a marble that could be gray, blue, purple or yellow.
StateFavorTiles
This enum contains all the possible states of a Favor Tiles of Maestri del Rinascimento board game.
Stone  
Strongbox
Class used to represents a strongbox in player board.
StrongboxOutOfBoundException
Exception thrown when number of occurrences related to a certain resource type becomes negative.
StrongboxTest
Class to test strongbox instance.
TakeResourcesController
Class that represents the controller of the Take Resources from Market page of the game On this page the user can perform the action of Take Resources From Market obtaining up to a maximum of 4 resources by choosing to take 3 or 4 marbles based on the choice of column or row
TakeResourcesFromMarket
Take Resources From Market action is organized as follows: the current player selects the marbles he wants to take from the market, then he attempts to perform a first positioning phase.
TakeResourcesFromMarketCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific state that is reached when the client chooses to take resources from the MarketTray during his turn.
TakeResourcesFromMarketError
Class containing information about errors triggered while performing a TakeResourcesFromMarket action.
TakeResourcesFromMarketError.Trigger
Enum that links each error with a simple description.
TakeResourcesFromMarketGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific state that is reached when the client chooses to take resources from the MarketTray during his turn.
TakeResourcesFromMarketMessage
Class containing information on how to perform a TakeResourcesFromMarket action.
TakeResourcesFromMarketMessageTest
Test class whose task is to check all possible outcomes for a TakeResourcesFromMarketMessage validity.
TakeResourcesFromMarketTest
Class whose task is testing take resources from market methods.
TakeResourcesFromMarketUpdate
Class representing second possible update resulting from a TakeResourcesFromMarket action.
TakeResPopupController
Class that represents the controller of the TakeResourcesPopup page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can see the update popup following a successful Take resources from Market action
Token
This class represents the tokens played by Lorenzo il Magnifico in SoloMode.
TokenEffect
All the possible token effects implement this interface and override each method depending on the different type of token.
Turn
This class represents a turn of the game flow phase of the game.
TurnController
This class represents the link between player in turn and the game.
TurnControllerHandleable
Interface that encapsulates all the messages that require an instance of TurnController to handle them.
TurnControllerTest
Class that deals with TurnController methods' tests.
TurnState
This class encapsulates the creation of the main action classes using a custom factory pattern.
TurnState.ActionType
Enum containing all the possible actions the player can perform during his turn.
UI
UI stands for User Interface and it is an abstract class containing methods used by CLI and Gui related to users game experience.
UpdateMessage
Abstract class representing a message sent from server to client in order to notify it that there has been a game state change.
User
This class provides a representation of the player needed at network level, when player's methods defined in model classes are not required.
UserDisconnectedMessage
Class representing a message sent by server in order to notify players currently involved in a game that one of them has just disconnected.
UsernameChoiceCLI
This class represents the CLI-specific username choice state which is reached by the client at the launch of the game.
UsernameChoiceGUI
This class represents the GUI-specific username choice state which is reached by the client at the launch of the game.
UsernameChoiceMessage
Class containing nickname chosen by user.
UserNameController
Class that represents the controller of the UserName page of the game On this page the user must enter the username to be used during the game and which will uniquely identify him to the server
VaticanReportSection  
VaticanReportSectionTest  
ViewDashBoardController
Class that represents the controller of the ViewDashBoard page of the game In this page the user not in turn is able to view the decks and the MarketTray of the game to check their status
ViewOtherPlayersController
Class that represents the controller of the ViewOtherPlayers page of the game In this page, which is shown as a popup, the user can choose to view the PlayerBoard of a player in the game in the case of MultiMode
WaitForTurnCLI
This class represents the Cli-specific wait for turn state that is reached by all the clients who aren't in turn.
Warehouse
Class representing the actual warehouse in player board as an object made by a strongbox, three depots and two possible extra depots (depending on player's active leader effects).
WarehouseTest
Test class that tests the correct functioning of the Warehouse class and its functionalities.
WhiteEffectMismatchException
Exception thrown when a player has two Effect of convert marble type active but he hasn't set any of them for at least one white marble taken from market.
WhiteMarble
This class represents a particular kind of marble that doesn't have an immutable resource type associated but it can change at runtime with regard to the strategy pattern.
WhiteMarbleEffect
This interface is used to implement a strategy pattern that allows white marble to encapsulate and change their runtime behaviour while taking resources from market.
WrongTurnError
Error caused by player who is attempting to do an action without being in turn.
